channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: NSW Nationals MP Leslie Williams has quit the party in disgust and will join the Liberals, saying she could not condone the reckless and unreasonable behaviour demonstrated over the past week.
item.title: 'Unhelpful and politically reckless': NSW Nationals MP quits to join Liberals

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: The latest news from Australia and the world on the COVID-19 pandemic.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE updates: Victoria records 14 new cases, five deaths on Sunday, Andrews request denied, Australia's death toll reaches 844

item.description: Victoria records 14 new cases, five deaths on Sunday as Australia's death toll reaches 844. Follow our live coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.description: Power have led the competition from go to whoa, but are not fancied for the premiership. The president thinks that is understandable.
item.title: We don't deserve to be favourites, says Port chairman Koch

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: Setting higher standards for aged care, and making sure they are met through increased scrutiny and transparent reporting, should be the precondition to taxpayer funding for the sector.
item.title: Aged care funding must be tied to higher standards and transparency

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: Gerald Ryan has always thought 1400m would be Peltzer's best trip and thinks he will show it in Saturday's group 1 Golden Rose at Rosehill.
item.title: Peltzer ready to relax and fire in the Golden Rose

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Perth chairman Tony Sage has flagged more stand-downs for players and staff, but the players' union has fired back amid increasingly tense pay negotiations.
item.title: 'Unhelpful and damaging': PFA slams Glory owner's 'misleading' letter

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Richmond have been dealt an injury blow on the eve of the finals with forward Jack Higgins hurting his calf during a practice match on Sunday.
item.title: Tiger Higgins struck down by calf injury

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: 'I never got to experience Air New Zealand in anything but a crisis,' says Foran in his first major interview with an Australian publication.
item.title: Air New Zealand boss says no trans-Tasman flights until March

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: The Canberra coach threw a water bottle from the coaching box before his side launched a comeback against the Warriors to stay in the hunt for fourth spot.
item.title: Ricky rages before Raiders show bottle and send top four down to wire

item.dc:creator: Hamish Hastie
item.description: In an emotional interview on Sunday Ms Buckly and Mr O'Reilly revealed that with nighttime approaching and temperatures continuing to drop they had begun to lose hope that they would find their son alive.
item.title: 'I went in the bush': Parents reveal how their hopelessness turned to joy after missing boy found

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: The Queensland Firebirds have caused an upset over minor premier Melbourne Vixens in the penultimate round but the result won't have any bearing on the top four.
item.title: Vixens knocked off in penultimate Super Netball round

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: As the Morrison government dealt with the fallout from the coronavirus pandemic, it also had to close a tax loophole for recycled oil.
item.title: Oils ain't oils ... for tax purposes

item.description: Global markets remain risky after another week of sell-offs in big technology stocks knocked investor confidence.
item.title: Tech stock sell-off keeps nervous investors on sidelines

item.dc:creator: Kerrie O'Brien
item.description: New research reveals the surprising scope, and value, of university art museums across the country.
item.title: University art exhibitions are the home of the brave, review finds

item.description: A new documentary revisits the moment baby Azaria vanished from a camp site at Uluru, and sees MeToo resonances in the subsequent witch-hunt against her mother.
item.title: Forty years on, Lindy Chamberlain's tragedy continues to reverberate

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: The NSW coach sounded out the State of Origin doctor, who guaranteed the Manly superstar would be right for the series opener.
item.title: Fittler confirms Origin berth for Trbojevic despite injury

item.description: Getting big leads has been relatively easy for the Boston Celtics in these eastern conference finals. This time, they also found a way to finish the job.
item.title: Celtics top Heat 117-106, cut east finals deficit to 2-1

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: Ben Stratton marked his final game by ending a goal drought that stretched back to 2010, leading Hawthorn to their first win in seven games and leaving coach Alastair Clarkson in hysterics on the bench.
item.title: Hawks steamroll Suns in Stratton, Puopolo farewell

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Webb
item.description: Staff of The Little Bookroom in Carlton North are hand delivering 100 books a day, part of bookshops having to embrace change to stay afloat.
item.title: 'I was terrified': bookshops navigate choppy waters during lockdown

item.dc:creator: John Shand
item.description: Felicity Wilcox could still cast a spell in her first post-lockdown performance.
item.title: Little gems come into focus as smaller audiences feel the spark

item.dc:creator: Josh Dye
item.description: The Prime Minister has accepted Gladys Berejiklian's request for NSW to join the program which pays people without sick leave $1500 when they self-isolate.
item.title: NSW workers get pandemic leave as state records first COVID-19 death in five weeks

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: An eye injury was part of the reason behind Mason Cox's struggles at the start of the season but he accepts it took him longer than he wanted to regain form. However his confidence is back after his performance against the Gold Coast on Monday night.
item.title: Mason Cox was 'essentially blind out of one eye', but it made him stronger

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: The Demons reported the possible breach and are waiting on the AFL integrity unit to complete its investigation.
item.title: Melbourne's Harley Bennell investigated for possible COVID-19 breach

item.description: Row erupts after India's minister of health said he had no figures on doctors' deaths, days after India became only the second country to reach the grim milestone of 5 million coronavirus cases.
item.title: India PM Modi accused of ignoring virus death of 380 doctors

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Mitch Aubusson became the most-capped Rooster of all time on Saturday, but tragedy and COVID-19 protocols put a dampener on the family celebrations.
item.title: 'I'm still dealing with it': The toll of Aubusson's tumultuous season

item.description: US President Donald Trump has given his "blessing" to an investment by software maker Oracle in Chinese-owned social media app TikTok.
item.title: Trump says deal between Oracle and TikTok has his ‘blessing’

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.description: Alan Moir, The Sydney Morning Herald's political cartoonist, sketches the political unreality.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Alan Moir

item.description: A selection of his best work.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Davidson

item.dc:creator: Colin Kruger
item.description: Getswift has defended its decision to leave the ASX and re-list in North America amid its legal battle with the corporate regulator.
item.title: Getswift says 'tremendous' US opportunity the reason for ASX exit

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, September 20, 2020

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, September 19, 2020

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: The Pies had been optimistic that Howe could get back from his ruptured PCL in 2020. There is better news for Will Kelly and Chris Mayne.
item.title: Collingwood officially rule Jeremy Howe out for the season

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Team Williams has wasted no time in locking in lightweight jockey Jye McNeil to ride Orderofthegarter for next month's Caulfield Cup.
item.title: McNeil to ride Orderofthegarter in Caulfield Cup on Ollie's advice

item.dc:creator: Chris Vedelago
item.description: The Australian pop anthem You're the Voice was adopted by a small flash mob of anti-lockdown protesters who made a brief appearance at Chadstone Shopping Centre on Sunday to sing that they weren't going to live in silence.
item.title: Two arrested, six fined after minor anti-lockdown protest at Chadstone

item.description: US President Donald Trump says he will make his nomination for a new Supreme Court justice this week. Could Republicans confirm the appointment before the presidential election?
item.title: How Republicans could quickly confirm Trump's Supreme Court nominee

item.description: Euan Macleod's latest exhibition is a visceral demonstration of the majestic unpredictability of the landscape.
item.title: Treacherous terrain suited to trying times

item.dc:creator: Michael Idato
item.description: Five Australians were nominated in four categories on the final night of the creative arts Emmys, but all left empty-handed.
item.title: Australia's campaign for Emmy glory stumbles

item.description: Laresa Kosloff's thoroughly mischievous film redeploys commercial footage for a timely message about capitalism, consumerism and the environment.
item.title: Mischievous art turns stock footage into radical satire

item.dc:creator: Hamish Hastie
item.description: A massive new deal has been inked that will change the face of the CBD forever. So what will we get?
item.title: eSports stadium and space robots: What the $1.5 billion Perth City Deal will mean for our city

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Cash incentives of $100,000 or more to entice international runners to Melbourne for our spring carnival features could be scrapped permanently.
item.title: Carnival prizemoney incentive enough for international raiders

item.dc:creator: Julie Power
item.description: In response to community opposition, Royal Sydney Golf Club - described as having the bluest of the blue blood members - will modify its development application.
item.title: Royal Sydney Golf Club bows to pressure to retain trees on the block

item.description: The Prime Minister has cracked down as British people are reported to be among the worst in Europe for complying with the rules.
item.title: Boris Johnson introduces $18,000 fines for COVID rule-breakers

item.dc:creator: Katina Curtis
item.description: The federal government is expected to release its technology road map on how the country can reduce its emissions this week.
item.title: Morrison says zero emissions achievable but won't commit to target

item.description: Rookie Matthew Wolff set up a shot at the first US Open win on debut since 1913 as Winged Foot again tamed big names.
item.title: Wolff steals show at U.S. Open, leads DeChambeau by two

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Melbourne captain Max Gawn said the behaviour of teammates Christian Petracca and Jayden Hunt, who were spotted touching each other inappropriately during coach Simon Goodwin's three-quarter-time address on Saturday, fell short of the club's standards.
item.title: Melbourne players apologise after inappropriate touching controversy

item.description: Follow the action from three AFL clashes on Sunday. First up, the Hawks face the Suns from 1.05pm.
item.title: Live AFL scores: Hawthorn v Gold Coast, Sydney v Geelong

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: The confirmation process for a Supreme Court justice typically takes around three months, but there are just over six weeks remaining until election day.
item.title: Trump vows to nominate 'brilliant woman' for Supreme Court this week
